page.title: 06THE LIGHTHOUSES.
page.content:
About 1760 an old fisherman and his wife lived near to the church. One stormy night, worried about her husband not coming home before dark, his wife put a candle in the window of the cottage to help him find his way. It saved his life! This was the first lighthouse.
About 100 years ago the tall lighthouse on the Berrow Road was built. It had a paraffin lamp and was 100 feet in height.
It was not until after the building was completed that they discovered that too low a vantage point had been selected to take into account the huge rise and fall of the tide at Burnham, so a second lighthouse on legs was built on the beach. These two are known as the High Light and Low Light.
